website_summaries.verdict: If you absolutely need your tent, tarp, or gazebo to stay firmly in place, these ultra-sturdy black steel stakes are the best option.
pros: Set of 10 forged steel tent stakes
Built-in hook and hole for easier tent pitching
cons: These are heavier and larger than the average tent stake

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These stakes work great! They are bigger than expected but very sturdy. I used them on my last camping trip to hold my 8-person tent. It survived a rain storm with no problems. They were easy to hammer down and pull out of the ground. They made a big difference over my cheap flimsy stakes that came with the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: These are some heavy duty stakes.
customer_reviews.text: 10 tent stakes, 1 extra green stopper, and a bundle of rope. The stakes are high quality, tried to bend them and I couldn't even a little. The stakes are pretty long, but you don't have to hammer the whole thing into the ground. Better too long than too short. Overall really nice tent stakes, even the plastic stoppers are hard and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycarl

customer_reviews.title: Strong stakes that hold up well!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy remove. The only stakes we use. Highly recommend. Used it during a huge windstorm, and it kept my tent from blowing away. The only stake that came out, was one planted into soft sand. The other 3 stakes stayed solid and kept our tent from blowing away in 50+ mph wind with 60-70 mph gusts!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua N. Dufek

customer_reviews.title: These are not tent stakes!
customer_reviews.text: These came up in my search for replacement tent stakes, and looked pretty good. I was not expecting Paul Bunyan camp gear. These are freakishly massive. I'm guessing they're for something more substantial/permanent than a tent, but I don't know what. I guess I didn't realize just how big 11 inches was for a stake. These should be more clearly marked, whatever they're for. If you're looking for something beefy, I can't imagine these every bending. They're heavy and solid.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Almost too good!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. I had so many bent and weak steaks from my years of camping, so I needed an upgrade. Held my tent and my canopy like a champ. Had trouble getting them out of the ground when tearing down camp, but all you have to do is wiggle them loose a bit. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Quality is great !!
customer_reviews.text: Of course Shipping is Great !! The quality of these stakes are high quality an would buy More from here !
customer_reviews.author: Michael Aldana

customer_reviews.title: Good solid stake
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought these stakes to replace the ridiculously flimsy ones that came with my yard inflatables. I have two 11 foot dragons (one for Halloween and one for Christmas), and a 6 foot abominable snowman. The "stakes" that came with them did not hold my inflatables on windy days so I purchased these stakes. They did an awesome job of keeping my inflatables secure in my yard. These are good solid stakes, with a good length, and they were definitely a good purchase. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Keep you tent where you want it
customer_reviews.text: These are serious stakes for a killer price - so much better than the cheesy ones that came with the tent!! I would not take these backpacking due to the weight but for car camping they are perfect - sturdy and did not pull out with the first use!! I know other people who use them for a long time - zero issues and these are the best price!! Shipped with just the right amount of packing too as an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Klein

customer_reviews.title: Did not last...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my pop canopy tent. Since we use it in a very windy area at times, I needed something sturdy. Most of them lasted for about 2 months, but quickly started not holding the canopy, some of the top broke which makes it challenging to remove, and a few times I had to go back out there because the canopy was heavier and it was pulling the stakes from the ground, even though I hammered them in all the way. Overall, I will not purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Car camping game changer
customer_reviews.text: I love having these in my kit for several reasons: (1) They get it done in a wide variety of terrain, (2) Extra stakes are almost always helpful, (3) They go in and stay in much better than most lightweight stakes. There is one possible downside besides the weight, and that is the durability of the green plastic heads. I received one replacement, but after 3 uses have already broken two heads. They should be fine if you take extra care to balance the force applied on both sides of the heads.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boardman

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent Stakes
customer_reviews.text: Tent stakes worked well, I bought these to replace the ones that I broke the tops off after Christmas was done, Frozen ground would not release them. Their great for pitching tents and other things.
customer_reviews.author: M.N.V

customer_reviews.title: Very strong tent stakes
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old granddaughter was able to put up our tent in the backyard without help using these stakes. The area at our home the ground is very hard, approximately the same hardness as concrete. Stakes which came with the tent bent easily, these stakes worked great. Removing the stakes wasn't quite as easy. I used a pair of vise grips to get them out. Recommend, if your soil is hard, that the stakes NOT be driven all the way. The wind blows pretty good in my area and the tent stayed put even in 30 mph wind using these stakes. I recommend these stakes for anyone putting up a tent on hard ground.
customer_reviews.author: westinld

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, sturdy, and tough
customer_reviews.text: These things rock! SO much sturdier than the flimsy ones typically included with your tent or shelter. They pound in straight and come out easy. Extra touches include a good length of nylon rope, and one extra stake head, if you should happen to break one. Do yourself and your tent a favor, and buy a set.
customer_reviews.author: seamusoldfield

customer_reviews.title: Great value for quality stakes
customer_reviews.text: Used a few of these on my recent trip tent camping in the Georgia mountains for several days. The stakes; tips were sharp and went into the ground easy and stayed in place even in 25 mph winds. They are a bit heavy in my motorcycle bag, but I knew they were when purchased. They are quality though. I would buy them again if needed. Also, the provided rope was strong for the size and served its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: They work very well at holding our 10’ x 20’ down in the wind. The only downside is when you try to pull them up, the plastic breaks. I have four if you add an oversized washer, it’s easy to pull out of ground with hammer or other device
customer_reviews.author: pslezak

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Slightly thicker than the ones they sell at target for $1 a piece
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Gooding

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty stakes
customer_reviews.text: If you want stakes that won't bend, are easy to drive, and will support your structure then look no further. Good for harder dirt/clay soils. Not good for soft soils/sand, you would want more of the blade shaped stake. I wouldn't want to take these backpacking, but I frequently camp in high wind areas with hard/clay soil. I JUST WISH THEY CAME WITH A STORAGE BAG!!! -1 star, because why not include a bag? I don't want them poking holes in my bags/tent while I'm transporting my gear around.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Guy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty. Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Its heavy duty. Three of four spikes was able to penetrate really hard dirt/ground without bending. One bent a little at the tip area. But good thing this came with more spikes. Cons: The plastic ends. All four that were used on the trip has some type of damage to it. The ends cant really use it for extracting, it tends to bend easily. Overall, happy with the item. Definitely an upgrade to the ones that come with the tent.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.R

customer_reviews.title: Wow! These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I can't count how many tent spikes I've destroyed. Most of them are crooked and barely hold down the tent. I purchased these for my one person tent, but the size and weight surprised me. I thought I made a mistake. They were too big and heavy. However, I gave them a try. Wow, these turned out to be amazing. Well worth the extra weight and space in my backpack. I can bang on them with rocks, stomp on them, and they never bend. These will probably outlast my tent.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Orchowski

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the trash stakes that come with your tent, buy these!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic stakes. We set up 2 tents and a small pop up shower tent with these stake, all weekend we had winds around 18 MPH and way too many gusts hitting up to 30 MPH for my comfort. These babies held everything down perfectly. Wish I could say the same thing for our kitchen tent that ripped across the seam the first time we had a gust of wind :/ but the stakes still held that bad boy into the ground like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It's been doing a great job holding my inflatable Grinch base plate in place even through some decent winds. The stakes look really sturdy and are the perfect length to go in deep enough to not get stuck. With that said, they do hold in the ground really well, but are a bit difficult to pull up. This is actually a good thing since you don't want whatever it is you're trying to hold down to come loose. Overall, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Orbital

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone. They works great. Comes with an extra orange piece and guidelines.
customer_reviews.text: Fits our tent anchor holes perfectly. Great for guidelines. Awesome even in the sand where we use them most. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gyroscopic

customer_reviews.title: Held strong during wind storm
customer_reviews.text: These were awesome! Got them for a tent we were going to set up at the beach. Once we got the tent set up and the spikes in the wind really started picking up but our tent didn't budge. We had someone next to us who had the spikes that came with their tent and I ended up chasing their tent down for them after a really big gust of wind blew it away....ours didn't move. Love these spikes so far and would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: SeahawkTech

customer_reviews.title: havent used these yet, but...
customer_reviews.text: i dont know why one of the criteria i was supposed to rate these on are "light weight". they're steel. nothing light weight about steel. ever. but i have used this type of peg before and they are great. i stuffed them in a pillow case along with an aluminum hammer, rolled it up, and stuck it in the saddle bag of my HD. still enough space left over for a 2 person tent, inflatable sleeping pad, tool kit, 3 bags of beef jerky, and a Mexican blanket.
customer_reviews.author: BINOBINOBINO

customer_reviews.title: So sturdy they might become Excalibur.
customer_reviews.text: I managed to bend two of these over a nine-day camping trip because I couldn't get them out of the ground (but they were still able to be used!) and I cracked the orange handles off on more than half of them. I don't know if the product is to blame or if I'm just tough on things.  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄ Overall though, these stakes were much better and studied than the ones that came with my tent. And, true to their namesake, they made it through rain and freezing temperatures without rusting at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Knarr

customer_reviews.title: Metal stakes for our dining tent
customer_reviews.text: Got these to add to our other metal stakes. They do get bent sometimes when pounding them into hard ground, but it is what we expected with our first set---which we've had for a few years. These were to replace some of the bent ones. I won't be surprised if some of these get bent. It is what it is. That's what happens when you pound something into a hard ground.
customer_reviews.author: PBAKER63

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard solid desert soil.
customer_reviews.text: Best ones I've ever used and I'm so glad I bought this extra set. I needed all of them. Hammering them in a hard solid soil (Arizona desert) was not a problem at all. I'm going to buy an extra set, just in case... it's worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Boonstoppel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good—plenty of length, but not quite as durable as I would have hoped. Bent the crap out of one on the first camping trip and really didn’t abuse them that much. Better that the absolute garbage that comes with virtually any tent, however.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: They are heavy duty. I had to use these to hold down my yard decorations especially a really large-heavy-expensive-reindeer. The stakes that come with most lawn decorations are just not adequate. I got tired of picking up my poor reindeer and other decor that kept toppling over. Not to mention I was afraid they would be damaged. I used these stakes and had not one thing fall over. Also we get quite a bit of rain and our soil is very soft. These held everything in place and did not rust like some of my other stakes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pridgen

customer_reviews.title: Strong and LONG Stakes
customer_reviews.text: Just used these stakes on a camping trip to Vermont. They were durable and long enough to get very firm anchor into the wet ground. Nice that they had plastic "tabs" at the top to tie paracord to, as well as to pry them out. The positive reviews are well justified.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Manhattan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a must for camping
customer_reviews.text: The stakes worked perfect for us. Actually a storm rolled through our camp site and our tent held firm while others using traditional inventory tent spikes were blown over and flattened. The spikes saved us from problems. There is a bit of a struggle pulling them back out so I suggest buying a tent stake puller of bring a large hammer so you and pry them from hard rocky ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The galvanized metal stakes are long sturdy and won't break like many of the plastic stakes. No problem in getting them in hard ground. Plastic tie down piece is also well made. I bought a second set. While it is nice that they included a piece of rope to use for tie downs it is relatively low grade and I swapped it out for paracord. If I need more stakes I will be buying these.
customer_reviews.author: William Evans

customer_reviews.title: SOLID - do not bend
customer_reviews.text: We got these to hold up our big halloween and Christmas blowups in our yard--the standard where too flimsy. They are VERY strong, I could hit them with a hammer to drive them in and they didn't bend. Not for a backpacking trip--but worked better than the plastic ones. The ropes were very thick (we only needed string/cord), so I didn't use them, but it was an added value.
customer_reviews.author: Chanimal

customer_reviews.title: good long lasting stakes
customer_reviews.text: i have used this style stake before with very good results. my last set lasted over a decade but got misplaced which is why i ended up ordering these. the metal is solid and can easily handle being hammered repeatedly. an old simple design that works as well today as they ever have. very good stakes at a reasonable price. if needed i would order these again.
customer_reviews.author: MikenzCO

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The best tent stakes I've come across for the price. I ordered a second set I liked them so much. UPDATE: the ropes became sun dried and crispy within a week. The stakes are holding up well, although the plastic tops are looking weak, but holding out. All in all, the stakes are still the best I've come across. Keeping the 5 star review because they are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kakstis 1

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sharp, went into the ground easily
customer_reviews.text: We used these to secure our 13 x 15 Coleman screen room. I used a 14 x 16 tarp for a floor and drove the stakes through both the tent supports and the tarp, they went in very quickly. We also used them to secure the tent support lines. They are holding well. We used this type of stakes the last time we put up a screen house, they lasted all summer and I had no problem removing them.
customer_reviews.author: Jean in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Works better than stakes that come with most tents
customer_reviews.text: The metal is a little soft. Our camp site was on heavily compacted soil and we bent a few of the stakes (one got almost a 45 degree angle inside the ground, made for some work to get it out). The tips on a few also flattened easily when striking small stones in the soil. Otherwise worked for what we needed and still better than the tiny stakes that come with most tents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stakes great, heavy duty. Rope a little cheap / light.
customer_reviews.text: Needed heftier tent stakes. The stakes are heavy duty as described, but I wouldn’t say they are lightweight nor would I want lightweight! The rope seems pretty cheap, but I wasn’t planning on really using that anyway. I would have rather paid a little less and not had the rope, or paid a little more and had a decent rope.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Pinnon-Becker

customer_reviews.title: Better than normal tent spikes.
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase for anyone needing to secure a tent. Only downside was very difficult to remove. The orange plastic started to break on a few of the spikes I had when attempting to remove them. Its good that they don't come out easily but when its time to go I almost didn't get them back out.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Heft

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted to return these as they were not light. Glad I didn't. It worked very well for our day tent and shower tent. It was fairly windy on 2 days and the shower tent didn't budge (so important!). When I removed the stakes, the shower tent dropped immediately with a mild breeze. Was difficult to remove (maybe I pounded them in too hard) but thankfully we were able to remove all the stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Tamic

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive for first time use.
customer_reviews.text: The spike is what I need to fasten my tent (Costco bought). The spikes with the tent are so short and no spike tip at all. Make it unusable to some sandy or gravel ground. These spikes are good in length and thickness. I used six of them one time this year in a Texas state park. Very easy to hammer down into the hard ground. I will updates later if more camping is in needs this year.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Makes setting up our tent so easy!
customer_reviews.text: Our tent, which we like, came with tent pegs that were a joke. These pegs changed our whole experience of setting up the tent. Easy to put in and remove, and make the tent feel very stable. Only thing is they are heavy, but that's why they work so well and we are not backpacking. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: shelbybee

customer_reviews.title: It is okay, get the aluminum y stake instead
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy & super heavy. I do not like the fact that the plastic part just keeps on falling out & cannot put back, which makes removing part much harder. Also, these are super heavy, I would refer something more lightweight & easier to carry around. Go for the aluminum y stake instead & thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Phuong

customer_reviews.title: Strong, durable tent stake
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. They insert in the ground easily and hold well - can be hammered if necessary. I bought them for the inflatable yard decorations I use. I gave a set to a relative who camps and received a good review. A minimalist backpacker might think twice because of the weight. When these are set at the correct angle they don’t come loose, yet they extract reasonably well because of the thin design.
customer_reviews.author: JWB

customer_reviews.title: You can pound these through solid steel and slay vampires with them
customer_reviews.text: Ok, slight exaggeration there, but WOW these things are tough. I've used many different kinds of tent stakes, from plastics to aluminum, and steel, and none have come close to these simple and solid stakes. I have broken or bent every stake on the market except these. Never bent a single one. These are the gold standard of ground spikes.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Working great!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased to hold a canopy down in a windy area. I have not rated the removal of them b/c we have not removed them. This is more for a semi-permanent situation ;) We used a hammer to set them in place and the first canopy was destroyed by the wind. I believe these stakes are holding the 2nd up well and it has been windy!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Here’s my review, please stop emailing asking for one.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to do the job. I’ve only used them once so far but I’m tired of getting emails from the seller to leave a review.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan P. McGorrin

customer_reviews.title: Good for many things in garden
customer_reviews.text: I purchased some statuary that was blown over by the wind. Although they came with stakes they were too small to be helpful. I used these on the statuary, the pop up canopy and the swing with awning. Keeps everything in place (though I'll probably take everything down is a hurricane comes)
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Beefy & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These beefy stakes helped my canopy avoid transformation into a sail in 50+ mph gusts. Several of my fellow festival campers weren't so well anchored. I will also add a note that the shape of these make it very easy to tie a secure knot. You don't need to be a sailing instructor to be successful with these.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: The plastic tops of these are extremely cheap and break easily. I've had mine for 2 months and already half of them have broken. I'm using them the same way I did a previous set that was good for ~15 years without more than 1 or 2 breaking, so the problem is definitely the cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little buggers!
customer_reviews.text: Just used these camping. Glad I got them because the area we were setting up was in very hard surface. Pounded them in with a heavy hammer and they worked flawlessly. Getting them out I still had to use the hammer, just like removing a nail in wood, but they didn't bend or break. Very sturdy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not only for tents
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my Christmas blow up needed better stakes to hold them down. We have alot of wet wild weather this time of the year. From Noerthearters to Blizzards I needed a longer stronger stake to do the job. these are perfect especially when the ground does not freeze yet I needed something longer to give blow up better support that didnt keep coming out of the ground---If they work this good for decorations they will be excellant for tent
customer_reviews.author: C. Londergan

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping in the Sierra Nevadas!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t say these are ‘lightweight ‘, but I wasn’t looking for lightweight, I needed a peg to get through our tough dry soil and to hold a tent down with the 4 nieces and nephews wreaking havoc. These worked like a charm. Held fast but we’re easily removed with peg removing hook on the mallet.
customer_reviews.author: G. Perez

customer_reviews.title: All around Tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the stakes to secure old blankets, tarps and other large material to cover several plants around the house to protect against cold weather freezing temperatures. The stakes are very stout and secured the coverings against high winds. Now Christmas rolls around and I used the stakes to secure some tall inflatable yard decorations. I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Balboa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lay flush with ground
customer_reviews.text: Used these instead of what came with our tent. There were high winds in the badlands and some other campers tents were blowing all over and destroyed. Ours never even budged! Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: Very serious tent stakes.
customer_reviews.text: I needed some sturdy tent stakes for my Cabela's tent/cot to hold it down when I'm not in it. Already had some, but needed some more. If you are looking for car/campsite stakes [a little too much weight for backpacking camping], they are great and very strong. Lov'em!
customer_reviews.author: jayhix07

customer_reviews.title: Large stakes with a solid build
customer_reviews.text: Have used them just once so far for my tent while camping over the weekend. Compared to the stakes that came with my tent, these are massive. They were easy to hammer in though, and also easy to remove. Definitely recommend these for holding down a tent or anything else outdoors
customer_reviews.author: Calvini

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy duty items.
customer_reviews.text: Barely stayed in the ground for what we were using these for. Bought two packs, the ropes were not sturdy at all! But we're lightweight, may be nice for a tent or something along those lines.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good stakes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these stakes to hold down lawn ornaments at Christmas, as well as for staking down our 10x10 canopy in the warmer months. They do their job and work great. I haven't broken any of the plastic tabs yet, but I'm glad they include a few extra.
customer_reviews.author: DukeAVW

customer_reviews.title: Really good stakes.
customer_reviews.text: These were a god send when I want hunting for tent stakes for my green house! I’ve had to replace the original cover as it was poor quality, but with my new cover I’ve gotten to use the included ropes. I would definitely buy more of these if the need for more arose.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Wright

customer_reviews.title: Go in super easy.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for yard inflatables. They maybe are TOO easy to remove. A good wind would yank them out, may be better if some texture to them. In fairness, the lower inflatibles held on fine. It was only the very tall one that I had to reseat almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Caine

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and practical
customer_reviews.text: They seem very sturdy and way better than the ones that came with my tent. They were very inexpensive and good for the price. I bought them to go camping and then didn’t get to use them because my trip was cancelled. I will update My review once I actually use them
customer_reviews.author: penguinio

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We used these to reinforce the Clam Shell tent stakes. Added to the ones that came with the tent. Helped to keep the tent stationary during the tropical storm. We ordered a second set. Easy to put in ground, easy to see and easy to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN  MESSICK

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ camping in a windy area. longer then expected but worked well. one of the orange "tops" broke when I was trying to remove it from a very dense part of the ground, I suppose that's expected- they give two extras so i'm not mad at this point.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenO

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: These are top quality Tent Stakes have used these before and these are the ones to get furthermore the cordage included is good quality NOT some cheap junk that is included with say a tube tent this cordage is a nice addition I threw it in one of my mini go bags as additional cordage 1 is none 2 is one. These stakes may even work on vampires.
customer_reviews.author: Timberwolf

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent Stakes
customer_reviews.text: I am using them to anchor a 20' aluminum tent pole arched dome over a fruit tree which I then covered with bird-netting. These stakes worked fine. They appear to be raw aluminum so I suspect the caustic soil will eat them up in a season but for the price, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mittens

customer_reviews.title: Bent on first use
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I thought these would work better than regular stakes. They bent on the first use. If you're going into sand, or virgin soil with no rocks, should be fine. If you have a pebble or two in the ground, these will bend just like normal stakes. Not worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: stalski

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: They pound into the ground without bending out of shape. They hold well, mine held perfectly for 6 months and when I went to remove them for relocation they were perfectly rooted. There were no signs of deterioration. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Beth

customer_reviews.title: SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised! they are basically ten inch long nails with solid plastic tops. I only used them for one camping trip but they worked great. I hammered them in with the back of my hatchet with ease and when it came time to remove them, they pulled right out once twisted a few times.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Very good  Glad I bought these
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used these to anchor my Christmas inflatables in the yard. Last year they blew over every time we had a strong wind. This year I bought these and they did the job. We had a high wind alert and these kept my inflatables right in place. Well worth the money. Their length let them godeep and hold the stuff in place
customer_reviews.author: Bugsbunny45

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Securing Tent, Tarp and EZ Up
customer_reviews.text: I used these while on a tent camping trip, during the remnants of a hurricane! Strong wind, and pouring rain didn't pull these loose! They held well against the storm, and helped keep me out of the weather! I used them to secure an EZ up, a tent and a tarp.
customer_reviews.author: P. Power

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We put up our tent the first time with the stakes that came with it. It was a frustrating process to say the least. I bought these stakes before our second camping trip. What a different experience! They hammered right into the ground without a problem. Cut the set up time in half, literally. Have only used once at this point but definitely recommend product!
customer_reviews.author: JTNR0269

customer_reviews.title: Love These Stakes!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to anchor my three sided garden gazebo. Good decision on my part that was driven by positive reviews. These sturdy stakes are easy to drive and provide a very discreet anchor for my gazebo legs. PERFECT!!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty & dependable
customer_reviews.text: These stakes & ropes added much needed stability to our shade tent during a windy weekend of garage sales. The stakes included with the purchase of the tent were shorter and made of a softer metal that was not up to the task of securing the tent.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Rope was completely unraveled
customer_reviews.text: The rope was completely unraveled when we opened it on the beach. We had no alternative but to use it but was very disappointed. The stakes were just fine and easy to use. Will have to purchase another kind of rope for our beach umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S Howat

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Nice and strong, won't rust or present problems further down the line. Extra hook room for flys / tarps / whatever. Good length for softer earth etc. Used these stakes on a recent camping trip where the ground makeup was 100% sand and these worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: DiddyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but way too heavy and big
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy, I suppose, but they are huge; they seem too big for any regular camping tent. I guess I did not realize/it is not clear in the description how big these are, they weigh the same as my 3-people tent!
customer_reviews.author: MartinaF

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdier and longer than I expected. They're not necessarily lightweight, but I use mine for a very large tent. They might be a bit excessive for a small, lightweight tent. Didn't bend when hammered into the ground, even when hitting big rocks. Also very easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: CBB

customer_reviews.title: Heavy AND Will not stay in ground
customer_reviews.text: Comes out too easily. Tried to use to secure tie downs for tarp poles. Did not stick into ground when orange aluminum Ozark trail stakes at 88 cents each worked wonders. Returned after trip. Thank god I had spare stakes available. Oh and they’re insanely heavy.
customer_reviews.author: em

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Stakes to Hold Down Tents and Canopies
customer_reviews.text: These are much better stakes than the flimsy ones that come with most tents or canopies. If companies don’t supply decent stakes with their products, these will fix the problem. They are very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Traveling

customer_reviews.title: Work great for my situation
customer_reviews.text: I am using them to secure the tarp on my swimming pool. The stakes are braced by the concrete sidewalk around my swimming pool, otherwise I don't think they would hold as they do not have enough surface area to resist the weight of the stretched tarp. They are sturdy and I like the tie off fixture
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible tent stakes.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tent you need these tent stakes. The stakes that came with my Coleman tent bent when I tried to hammer them into hard rocky soil. The Eurmax stakes hammered in with no problem, firmly securing the tent through a gusty rain stormy weekend.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Macias

customer_reviews.title: Excellent steaks at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent steaks at a reasonable price. Certainly strong... j Now if they just made these a little lighter, LOL. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AXerxes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Canopy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product that we use for camping. It is a bit heavier than many others, but, will withstand more wind than others. I really like the fact that you can leave the canopy on the frame when packing it up. We added a Velcro strap to wrap around the canopy and hold it to the frame when packing it up. This keeps the canopy from flopping when packing it into the transport case. We also added  rope cinches to the ropes provided to make snugging the ropes up easier. I would recommend this canopy to anyone wanting a solid canopy.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Handy items to have
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I used them to anchor chicken wire cages around my bushes. I planted a new variety of vertical bush in my yard and something kept eating the tips of the branches. I installed a wire cage around each one, tall enough to protect it and anchored each cage to prevent blowing over in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Cychosz

customer_reviews.title: I love these stakes
customer_reviews.text: I love these stakes. I would have give them 5 stars but I was missing one there were only nine in the pack
customer_reviews.author: Msmjfig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tent Stakes
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why I didn't buy this type of stake a long time ago. No more bent stakes! They are easy to use in all soil types found in state and national campgrounds. I would just make sure you using a tent with D-ring type attachment points as the stakes are quite thick. They stay in the ground so well that you will most likely need a hook of some sort to pull them out again. Buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product worked for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to hold down a small Greenhouse that I bought from Amazon and they work wonderfully we have had some intense winds the last few days and that green house has not moved a bit wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Easterwood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Outdoor Blowups (Christmas Decorations)!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I bought these because the wind was blowing our Christmas blowups literally out of the ground. Decided to give it a try and I’m more than impressed. If we ever expand our outdoor decorations I will definitely be purchasing another set. Easy to hammer in the ground and easy to pull up.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: If you like your tent and your rainfly, spend the extra money to stake them down right
customer_reviews.text: Being warned that our new tent came with low quality spikes, we bought these to go with it. They went easily into the moderately soft ground and held well yet were easily pulled out (with our handy tent tool) when it was time to pack up. Didn't use the rope for anything, but the spikes are a win and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: S. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal
customer_reviews.text: We used these to stake a rent while camping the weekend after receiving. 3 were bent after the first use. Stakes were set with a rubber mallet and no rocks were present. Cheap metal.
customer_reviews.author: J-me

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: As described. Easy to install. A hammer is sometimes necessary. And you can use the hook end of the hammer to remove. The bright colors make them easy to find on cloudy darker days.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Great stakes
customer_reviews.text: Great tent stakes. Used them for two tents camping, heavy duty, took the pounding of a large hammer to drive them into the ground with out bending and were easy to pull out when we packed up. Much better than the cheap stakes that came with the tents.
customer_reviews.author: Dap

customer_reviews.title: Secure wind protection in dry ground
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to keep my canopy shelter secured during a 4-day camping music festival in the mountains where there was wind. Other tents and canopies blew away, but mine stayed in the ground. The stakes are sturdy and stay in dry ground very well. Having a stake hammer is a must for these.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Tent Stakes
customer_reviews.text: I use these stakes to hold down the tarp over my lawn sweeper in the back yard. I don't have room in the tool shed for it and the stakes keep the tarp over it even in strong wind.
customer_reviews.author: Everett G. Lackey Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: So worth the money. I got a nice tent but it had junk spikes. I got these right away. These go right into any hard ground easy. They held great in high winds. And they are easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: It's a nail
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's just a giant nail with a plastic cap, but it is the right thing to get the job done. We live in Hill Country TX where the ground is rocky and hard. Having a real spike to drive into the ground is a necessity. These will never bend and will drive through the hardest of soil and hold until you pull them. When you want them out they will just slide out, but only when you want them to and not until then.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite tent stakes. Very durable, easy to hammer in and easy to remove. Too heavy for backpacking but perfect for tent camping. Perfect replacement for the stakes that come with most tents.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Elmo

customer_reviews.title: Works well garden
customer_reviews.text: I use these in garden to hold firm the drip irrigation tubes. The stakes push in easily and have a good bright top. This helps to find them at the end of growing season.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Strong

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Used these for securing tarps over my wood piles. Worked very well as long as you have solid ground. Had heavy winds a number of days and these kept the tarps secure.
customer_reviews.author: Cy

product_meta.title: Eurmax Galvanized Non-Rust Camping Family Tent Pop Up Canopy Stakes 10pc-Pack, Bonus 4x10ft Ropes & 1 Green Stopper
feature_bullets: ✔10 – pack with Bonus 4 10ft Ropes & 1 Green Stopper
✔Heavy-duty set of peg stakes，Approx. ¼", ( 8 mm )
✔Milled points prod easily into hard soil with large head for mallet driving.

✔Essential tool for securely anchoring tents, canopies, patio & garden structures, or landscape trim..Suitable for most of the tent,like Coleman Sundome 2 Person Tent, Sundome 4 Person Tent ★★★Aluminum Multi-function tent Hammer Stake Mallet B07CBM2ND9.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,610 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
